Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported API which the applications need to invoke in order to use the driver.

Function Documentation

int32_t CRC_cancelSignature ( CRC_Handle  crcHandle,
uint32_t  transactionId,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to cancel the signature generation.

Parameters
[in]crcHandleCRC Driver Handle
[in]transactionIdTransaction Id for which the signature generation is being canceled
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t CRC_close ( CRC_Handle  crcHandle,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to close a previously opened CRC Driver

Parameters
[in]crcHandleHandle to the CRC Driver to be closed
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t CRC_computeSignature ( CRC_Handle  crcHandle,
CRC_SigGenCfg *  ptrSigGenCfg,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to compute the CRC signature for the specified data. It is possible to invoke the API multiple times in which case the CRC signature is computed across multiple data buffers.

Parameters
[in]crcHandleCRC Driver Handle
[in]ptrSigGenCfgPointer to the signature generation configuration
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t CRC_getSignature ( CRC_Handle  crcHandle,
uint32_t  transactionId,
uint64_t *  ptrSignature,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to get the generated signature.

Parameters
[in]crcHandleCRC Driver Handle
[out]transactionIdTransaction Id for which the CRC signature is being retreived
[out]ptrSignaturePointer to the generated signature
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t CRC_getTransactionId ( CRC_Handle  crcHandle,
uint32_t *  transactionId,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to allocate a unique transaction identifier for the CRC operation. Transaction identifiers are used to identify the CRC signature generation procedure since it is possible that the CRC compute signature API can be invoked multiple times. If there are multiple users of the same CRC Driver we should ensure that the User1 compute signature is not interrupted with the User2 request.

The transaction identifers are automatically released once the result of the signature is requested OR if the signature request is cancelled.

Parameters
[in]crcHandleCRC Driver Handle
[out]transactionIdUnique Transaction Identifier allocated
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
void CRC_initConfigParams ( CRC_Config *  ptrCRCCfg)

Description
The function is used to setup the default configuration parameters for the CRC Driver.

Parameters
[out]ptrCRCCfgPointer to the default configuration which is populated by the API
Return values
Notapplicable
CRC_Handle CRC_open ( const CRC_Config *  ptrCRCCfg,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to open the CRC Driver with the specific configuration.

Parameters
[in]ptrCRCCfgPointer to the CRC configuration
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- CRC Driver Handle
Error- NULL
